cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 415 miles SSE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northward on Friday then accelerate N and NNE this weekend, aiming toward southern New England/Long Island
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England coast (Rhode Island or southeastern Connecticut vicinity)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet; watches expected from Long Island eastward to New England on Friday
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic and New England coastline from New Jersey northward, greatest effects southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Low but rising chance (14% cumulative) of sustained 34-kt winds; most likely peak gusts 35-40 mph Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge possible along Delaware Bay/River, but significant (>3 ft) surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 1â€“2 inches of rain possible Sunday into early Monday with locally higher pockets
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along New Jersey and Delaware beaches beginning Saturday
